meanings.definition: A person or animal with a thick and sturdy build.
meanings.sent1: The thickset bear lumbered through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The thickset wrestler easily lifted his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The thickset dog tried to squeeze through the small doggy door.
meanings.sent4: His thickset frame made him a formidable opponent on the rugby field.
meanings.sent5: The thickset buffalo stood proudly on the savannah.

meanings.definition: Dense or closely packed together, especially referring to plants or vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The thickset bushes created a natural barrier along the path.
meanings.sent2: The thickset forest was difficult to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The thickset vines seemed to be hugging the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The thickset clouds blocked out the sun, casting a shadow over the valley.
meanings.sent5: The thickset crowd at the concert made it hard to see the stage.
